goals.question: What is the distribution of obesity rates across all states?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of obesity rates across all states and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the average obesity rate for each region?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of average obesity rates by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us compare the average obesity rates across different regions and identify any regional trends.

goals.question: What is the relationship between obesity rates and state population?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of obesity rates vs state population
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is any correlation between obesity rates and state population.

goals.question: What is the distribution of obesity rates for each state?
goals.visualization: Box plot of obesity rates by state
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of obesity rates within each state and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of state populations across all regions?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of state populations by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of state populations across different regions.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='rate', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of obesity rates across all states?', wrap=True)
    plt.axvline(data['rate'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean: {:.2f}'.format(data['rate'].mean()))
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby('region')['rate'].mean().reset_index()
    sns.barplot(x='region', y='rate', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the average obesity rate for each region?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(x='id', y='rate', data=data, hue='region', palette='deep')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between obesity rates and state population?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.set(style="whitegrid")
    chart = sns.boxplot(x="state", y="rate", data=data)
    plt.title("What is the distribution of obesity rates for each state?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    region_populations = data.groupby('region')['id'].sum().reset_index()
    chart = sns.catplot(x='region', y='id', data=region_populations, kind='pie', legend=False)
    chart.set_axis_labels('Region', 'Population')
    chart.fig.suptitle('What is the distribution of state populations across all regions?', wrap=True)
    chart.add_legend()
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
